Reviewing.description: I want to demonstrate how easy it is to automate making a public backlog. As a side benefit I might learn what content people might be most interested in - and it * should * be motivating for me to see a nice list of ideas in the ‘published’ column.
Reviewing.label: everything-else

Ideas in the long grass.summary: Throw out your Kanban board: other ways to plan work and radiate intent for rapid collaboration
Ideas in the long grass.description: Some structures (like Kanban and Scrum) used incorrectly can lead to a trained ‘helplessness’. Some creative destruction is sometimes necessary to radically change the status-quo. Here’s some options.
Ideas in the long grass.label: teams

Ideas in the long grass.summary: My approach to Dev Ex
Ideas in the long grass.description: Dev Ex is too narrow minded for multi-disciplinary teams. Here’s some thinking on how I focus on changing the ‘experience of work’ for everyone for the better.

Ideas in the long grass.summary: What is delivery management?
Ideas in the long grass.description: I keep coming to community sessions where people ask, what is a delivery manager. Despite other great writing on the subject, I think it’s still a valid question to have a take on.

Ideas in the long grass.description: Sharing my excitement for this excellent book with others.

Ideas in the long grass.summary: Using Maslow's hierarchy of needs as a Dev Ex planning tool
Ideas in the long grass.description: A case study about using Maslow’s hierarchy as a frame for prioritising and decision making when a team is struggling to keep the day-to-day going.

Ideas in the long grass.summary: Dealing with the tortoise and the hare

Ideas in the long grass.summary: A newfound awareness of the ground under your feet

Ideas in the long grass.summary: Focus: Beware! Distractions everywhere
Ideas in the long grass.description: Close your eyes and think of Slack, Teams, Hangouts. You can hear it. Buzz buzz, beep beep - give me your attention now please. On the importance of being really disciplined in your team about the power you have to create distractions.
Ideas in the long grass.label: teams

Ideas in the long grass.summary: Accessible, inclusive facilitation
Ideas in the long grass.description: Some tips for making sessions that you run accessible and inclusive for everyone.

Ideas in the long grass.summary: A case study: accessing health services with panic attacks
Ideas in the long grass.description: In my team we use some accessibility persona’s. They’re useful, and build empathy about users with access needs that you might not experience. Here’s a case study of an experience of trying to access some health services while suffering from severe panic attacks.
